Events that occurred on 3 March.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1955 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 159, mentioning Charles Williams.
1973 - A tobacco bill is submitted to J.R.R. Tolkien, on which he scribbles a note.
1983 - The Monsters and the Critics is published in the UK.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3019:
Frodo, Sam and Gollum cross the plain between the Dead Marshes and the Black Gate.
Ceorl meets Théoden's band and tells about the defeat in the Second Battle of the Fords of Isen.
Gandalf goes to Isengard and Théoden retreats to Helm's Deep, where the Battle of the Hornburg ensues.
Battle of Isengard; the Ents, led by Treebeard, change the course of Isen and complete the destruction of Isengard.
